diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Acute appendicitis without mention of peritonitis
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of acute appendicitis was supported by symptoms of worsening abdominal pain that migrated to the right lower quadrant (RLQ), tenderness in the RLQ on examination, and imaging findings from CT showing a dilated and fluid-filled appendix with periappendiceal inflammatory fat stranding, but no evidence of abscess or free fluid.
